DataElement.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization del(17p13) Outcome Absent Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The absent or present indicator related to the result of using Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization to identify a deletion of chromosomal material at 17p13, this chromosomal aberration includes deletion of the TP53 gene and is associated with multiple myeloma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization del(17p13) Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._A deletion of chromosomal material at 17p13. This chromosomal aberration includes deletion of the TP53 gene and is associated with multiple myeloma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of IN SITU HYBRIDIZATION in which target sequences are stained with fluorescent dye so their location and size can be determined using fluorescence microscopy. This staining is sufficiently distinct that the hybridization signal can be seen both in metaphase spreads and in interphase nuclei.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.

Property.preferredDefinition: A deletion of chromosomal material at 17p13. This chromosomal aberration includes deletion of the TP53 gene and is associated with multiple myeloma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: A deletion of chromosomal material at 17p13. This chromosomal aberration includes deletion of the TP53 gene and is associated with multiple myeloma, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia and myelodysplastic syndrome.
